metadata.dc:author: Kofman Alfaro, S
Moreno Arenas, G
Richardson Corral, V
Vergara, M D
metadata.dc:description: Costovertebral dysplasia is characterized by dysmorphic dwarfism at the expense of the trunk, with typical costal and vertebral anomalies that cause displacement of the intrathoracic and intra-abdominal organs and reduced pulmonary function. There is a recessive severe variety manifested in the newborn and a rare dominant form which is more benign.
metadata.dc:title: Displasia costovertebral.
[Costovertebral dysplasia].
metadata.dc:publisher: Boletin medico del Hospital Infantil de Mexico
